Why not use a LTS (Long Term Supported) rlease rather than a rolling release? However if you want a rolling release with a slower pace of updates you could try Slitaz, or the puppylinux version of it TazPup
http://murga-linux.com/puppy/viewtopic.php?t=113255
BTW, do you really need to upgrade everything? Perhaps you could create a list of critical libraries, which you would give as priority upgrades.
And those who remember the past are powerless against the cycles of history. Actually though they aren't really cycles.As Mark Twain said, "History doesn't repeat, it rhyms".
@leftside: I think there is a zeronet site about the IPFS.

@leftside: Major social media platforms are also ranking users so called "trustworthiness" based on the content that they share. This is as much a consequence of technology as it is of any specific authoritarian nature of China. 

The solution is to use anonymous p2p platforms like zeronet (with tor) and freenet.
